Name: TAC-2 Joystick x2
Comment: The white version

Name: Gamecube Controller
Comment: The one included in the box. Black

Name: Gamecube Controller x3
Comment: All black

Name: Gamecube Game Boy Player
Comment: Black. No box for the adapter itself. Only for the disc. Model No: C/L-DOL-A-GP-EUR. DOL-017.

Name: Gamecube Memory Card 251 x3
Comment: One still factory sealed

Name: AC Adapter
Comment: Manufactured by Big Ben

Name: Action Replay Xtreme
Comment: French instruction book and box.

Name: EMS USB 64M Smartcard
Comment: A flashcart for Game Boy with multi-ROM support and a mini USB port to transfer ROMs over from a PC with a transfer application. Has the number 1212 burned into the back.

Name: Game Boy Pocket official replacement screen x2
Comment: Contrary to the linked picture (which is the photo the seller used...), it does not have holes for the power LED. I have two of these.

Name: Game Boy Pocket replacement screen x2
Comment: With power LED-hole!

Name: Game Boy Pocket Silver official replacement screen
Comment: Silver border, without a hole for the power LED.

Name: Lightmaster magnifying glass + light
Comment: A black one. The light on this is really bad.

Name: Mega Drive controller
Comment: With white start button

Name: Mega Drive controller x2
Comment: Third party 6-button pads

Name: Pro Action Replay 1
Comment: German release. Box and instructions in german, code book in english. Includes registration card.

Name: Famicom Disk System RAM Adapter
Comment: Ram adapter only, no disk drive. Has a 4.7k resistor array installed on the PRG data lines to fix glitchy graphics on some systems.

Name: Famicom Everdrive N8
Comment: White shell

Name: FDSstick
Comment: Disk Drive emulator for Famicom Disk System

Name: NES Connector
Comment: The connector that used to sit in my childhood machine. Needs cleaning and re-bending of the pins to work.

Name: NES Controller x2
Comment: NES-004E, brand new. One has never been used, still wrapped in factory plastic.

Name: NES Controller x5
Comment: Regular Scandinavian NES-004 controllers of varying quality I've gathered over the years.

Name: NES Four-Score Adapter
Comment: NES-034A. Works with both NES-004 and NES-004E controllers on both SCN and NTSC consoles. Probably won't work on a German NES though.

Name: NES Gold-plated Connector
Comment: A gold-plated connector for NES. Seems kind of rare. Used to see them from time to time when I bought it, but now I haven't seen one in years. I now use it in my NTSC machine.

Name: NES PowerPak
Comment: Flashcart for NES. Includes transparent dust-sleeve with "RetroZone" written on it, and a 2GB Compact Flash memory card. Says "POWERPAK rev E" on the PCB.

Name: NTDEC 60->72pin Converter
Comment: Converter to play Famicom games on the NES. It was probably intended for the Russian or Chinese clone market because it doesn't seem to have a lockout chip in it. If used on a non-region modded console it just reboots every 1 second.

Name: Circle Pad Pro
Comment: The one that came with Resident Evil: Revelations

Name: 64drive homebrew cartridge
Comment: The PCB has the 7101 CIC lockout chip installed, in a black PAL cartridge case modded with CF card and USB port openings. Linux says the serial number is FTV9EI5E (old one that I replaced had FTV84KYM). Currently running Menu 1.11c, Firmware 1.05 and Bootloader 1.01.

Name: N64 Controller x2
Comment: One gray and one blue. I have replaced the analog sticks with new GC-style sticks that won't wear out like the original ones. They are however a bit shorter so the sensitivity is a bit higher than normal.

Name: N64 Expansion Pak
Comment: Missing the plastic tool to remove the jumper pak with.

Name: Acekard 2i
Comment: Flashcart for NDS. Includes the MicroSD card reader.

Name: R4DS
Comment: Flashcart for NDS. Includes the MicroSD card reader, cartridge dust case and strap.

Name: Games Master Converter
Comment: Converter for SNES to play NTSC games on PAL consoles

Name: Honey Bee Super-Magic Game Converter
Comment: Converter for SNES to play NTSC games on PAL consoles

Name: Nintendo Scope
Comment: Called Super Scope outside PAL-land

Name: Pro Action Replay 1
Comment: Cheat adapter and region converter for SNES.

Name: SD2SNES
Comment: Flashcart for SNES. With universal case. Revision E1 / 2012-02-10

Name: SNES Mouse
Comment: A bit yellowed

Name: Super Game Boy
Comment: Product code: SNSP-A-SG(UKV)

Name: 3rd Party Wii Nunchuck
Comment: Same as the above with the addition that it seems to make the IR pointer more laggy in homebrew apps for some reason.

Name: 3rd Party Wii Remote
Comment: Blue/Teal. Looks exactly like an official Wii remote, except for the fact that it doesn't say Nintendo or Wii. Instead, it's called WÃ¼. The buttons aren't as good as the original and the rumble feels weak and makes a lot more noise. The speaker is also often garbled. Otherwise works well.

Name: Wii MotionPlus
Comment: Black. With "jacket".

Name: Wii MotionPlus
Comment: White. With "jacket".

Name: Wii Nunchuck x2
Comment: White

Name: Wii Remote x2
Comment: White
